knimeNode.name: Interactive Differential Function Fitting
knimeNode.shortDescription: Fits data to a scalar function consisting of first order differential equations.

fullDescription.intro: Fits data to a scalar function consisting of first order differential equations. The table from the second input port must contain "time/dependent-variable" pairs. The table from the third input port must contain "time/condition" tuples.

tab.name: Display Options
tab.option: If checked, a legend is shown below the chart.
If checked, the data points in the chart are connected by lines.
Number of points, that are evaluated for each function to draw the graph. This also controls the integration step size for drawing the graph.
Condition values are just provided for specific times. The integration algorithm must interpolate between these values. This option specifies the interpolation function to use.

tab.name: Range
tab.option: If checked, the lower left corner of the chart is set to (0/0).
If checked, the ranges of the chart can be manually set via "Min X", "Max X", "Min Y", "Max Y". Otherwise the ranges are set automatically.
Minimum value of x-Axis.
Maximum value of x-Axis.
Minimum value of y-Axis.
Maximum value of y-Axis.

tab.name: Variables
tab.option: Variable for the x-Axis.
Variable for the y-Axis.
Optional transformation of the x-Axis variable.
Optional transformation of the y-Axis variable.

tab.name: Parameter Values
tab.option: Slider for setting the parameter's start value used in the optimization algorithm. The slider is only enabled if limits have been set.
Field for setting the parameter's start value used in the optimization algorithm.
Limits for the parameter's start value. These limits can be enforced in the optimization algorithm. And when limits are set, the value slider is enabled.

tab.name: Fitting
tab.option: If checked, the optimization algorithm only return results, where the parameter values are in the specified boundaries.

option.name: Maximal Iterations in each run of Optimization Algorithm

tab.option: This option specifies the maximum of iterations of the optimization algorithm for each start value combination.
If checked, the same values for differential equation parameters are used for all data sets. Otherwise each data set is fitted separately.

If checked, for each data set a different value for *_0 is computed. That means, that the respective differential equation has a different start value for each data set. Otherwise all data sets use the same start value.
The Rungeâ€“Kutta method is used for integrating the differential equations. This options specifies the step size to use during the fitting.

ports.inPort: Scalar function consisting of first order differential equations, that is fitted to the data.
Dependent Variable Data, to which the function is fitted.
Conditional Variable Data, to which the function is fitted.
ports.outPort: Parameter values and some quality measures.
